column4: Hm, I installed cups-pdf and it created a PDF printer, but when I print to printer PDF, where does the output file show up?
~/PDF
Ah, thanks, had to create ~/PDF for it to print to.
you'll be much happier with the -alternate CD image
Really?
really. parted is menu-driven. selecting what aprtitions to mount and use where is a breeze.
remember, you're going to have to match UUIDs and such across installs to get file permissions happy.
Right... does that just mean I have to tweak /etc/passwd & etc to make sure the user accounts have the same numbers?
just get used to creating users and groups from the command line, and you can tell the OS what UUID to assign.
Okay, that's easy enough.
but if you know what /etc/passwd *is* you are well capable of running the alternate install.
I'm pretty familiar with this stuff, it's just the dual-boot aspect that's new to me.
So I run the alternate install CD, manual partitioning, select the new / for the system, select existing /home, then install, right?
the alternate installer has a few more install tweaks easily available. such as defining partition use and mount points, LUKS, dm-crypt etc etc
And afterwards, make sure I create users with the same UUIDs.
How do I set up the boot process?
right, you'll get to partitioning, see the stuff that already there, and assign a mount point. you can tell the installer NOT to format it
the GRUB installer should find the other /boot and menuitizerize it
The GRUB installer from the new (11.10) install?
another /boot should make GRUB set up menu entries for the other installation. but i have not done any of this recently.
Okay, thanks.
Sounds risky enough that I'm going to wait until I get home and see if the overnight backups executed properly (didn't have time to check this morning :-()
you around?
